etymologies: early 20th century. From the name of Woldemar Roscher, German pharmacist and mineral collector + -ite, after German Roscherit

definitions: A phosphate mineral occurring chiefly as reddish or brownish crystals in cavities in granite and pegmatite.

notes.text: Roscherite is a hydrated phosphate and hydroxide of beryllium, calcium, iron, and manganese, Ca(Mn,Fe)₂Be₃(PO₄)₃(OH)₃·2H₂O. Crystal system: monoclinic. The presence of beryllium was not discovered until 1958, the mineral previously having been believed to contain aluminium.
